subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Is there any way to get a franks box ???
author: Lisby
full_text:
Misty--where are you located?

Ann

On May 19, 2007, at 11:43 PM, Misty Dawn wrote:

> Yeah Frank knows he left a few details out, he mentioned that a  
> while back its why he keeps updating schematics. The ST method is  
> something him and Dave termed, and I just took the idea, ran with  
> it and put it to the test...still testing. So far it works as well  
> for me as any other method tho its sound frequencies can be heard  
> easily by more people.
>
> Congrats to you both on your upcoming engagements I wish it wasnt  
> on the other side of the states i'd drop in. I am not much of a  
> "speaker" but I try and get my typing in as much as I can hehehe.  
> Im a big goof when ya stick me in front of a room of people.
>
> You should give it a try I think you may be surprised. But again, I  
> am getting great results with all methods as far as my own hearing  
> goes...but I do see others can hear these easier for the most part.  
> It has to do with the frequency levels it hits. Spirit says 5 to 1  
> people do not have perfect hearing and that is why we all hear so  
> differently and why some agree while others cant hear a thing but  
> static. Think of it as a dog vs human scenario...dog whistles hit  
> that frequency many people cant hear...I hear them but for some its  
> silence....for the dog its very loud and clear. I think they match  
> each recording mediums vibrations and in effect tune into speaking  
> in a way so you can hear them...even if you are the only one that  
> can hear them.
>
> Very interesting about the stone circles, I was just thinking of  
> this not too long ago and also researching "singing" stones after I  
> saw a headline about them on the news. They do exist. Some also  
> have electromagnetic functions which come into play. I love rocks,  
> always have, and I have collected them since I was small long  
> before I knew as much as I know now. They also play a big part in  
> some of my ITC images that have come thru. They still shock me with  
> the clarity sometimes.
>
> It is all very very humbling for me. I am nobody special, not  
> someone who wants to be famous, nor one who would have ever thought  
> I would/could be involved doing research on something such as this  
> for so long and remain so dedicated (or is that addicted LOL) but  
> one small voice sent me on a sharp turn and now I am on this path.
>
> Paranormal has always been just normal...now moreso than ever. I  
> think perhaps they have always been watching me and they are the  
> voices that kept me awake at night, the invisible person sitting on  
> my bedside so I couldnt fall asleep and would scream for my mama to  
> come stay with me until I fell asleep. I could probably name 1000  
> things that I have witnessed and others have witnessed over my  
> lifetime but too tired to start that list tonight LOL
> I never realized how closed my eyes were until they opened wider. I  
> always knew what was there I just never realized it in detail.
>
> Misty
> Guy <yzzzguy@...> wrote:
> Thanks, Bill! (Pssst...check is in the mail...he he)
>
> I want to make it clear that I was NOT criticizing Frank about his
> box or the document! It's just that I read it over thoroughly
> yesterday and found some things that were missing or unreadable.
> Otherwise - it's the only "one-stop shopping" for details on Frank's
> box. The setup is not rocket science...anyone versed in electronics
> could build one and even improve on the design (I have several
> thoughts on that).
>
> I haven't had a chance to check out Misty's "sweep tuning" method
> but just that name seems to indicate something close to the "manual"
> way of creating Frank's box as I previously mentioned (i.e. randomly
> pushing radio buttons).
>
> Lastly - as Bill said - he and I will be presenters at the
> conference in July. My particular presentation (which I'm still
> piecing together) will be on Paranormal Sound Phenomena. Rather than
> rehash techniques for recording/analyzing EVP - I plan on going into
> more depth on present/past research in paranormal sounds (such as
> playing the first spirit voices ever recorded, ultrasonic pulses
> detected at stone circles, etc.) and make a plea to participants to
> stretch beyond present emphasis on just recording said sounds but
> get into broader research projects. I'm not one to "toot my own
> horn" but I'm also slated to appear on the June 3 show of Ghostly
> Talk (http://www.ghostlytalk.com) to go into more depth on the
> famous (or infamous) Spiricom Mark IV story.
>
> Guy
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vilhellm@...> wrote:
> >
> > To expand upon Guy's post, the echo chamber size can vary. Some of
> his
> > boxes have an internal chamber that's about 2" x 3.5". Some of his
> > boxes have chambers which are external and are a bit larger. An
> > external one I saw was made with a light wood frame which was
> wrapped
> > in heavy aluminum foil.
> >
> > If someone is considering constructing their own FB then I suggest
> > considering the sweep tuning method also as the recordings I've
> heard
> > are impressive. We are experimenting with a RVG equipped box and
> are
> > getting good results but I am also interested in the sweep tuning
> > approach.
> >
> > By the way, Guy and myself both be speaking at the upcoming South
> > Coast Paranormal Convention July 20 and 21 in Santa Paula, CA. see
> > link: http://www.woodwardpsychic.com/
> >
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Guy" <yzzzguy@> wrote:
>
>
>
> Give spam the boot. Take control with tough spam protection
> in the all-new Yahoo! Mail Beta.
